msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Genesis 31
ab.l: And Jacob heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying,‘Jacob has taken away all that was our father’s, and he has made this fortune from that which was our father’s.’
And Jacob saw the countenanceof Laban, and, lo, it was not toward him as before.
And the Lord said to Jacob, ‘Return to the land of your fathers, andto your kindred, and my help will be with you.
AndJacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the fieldto his flock.
And he said to them, ‘I seeyour father’s countenance, that it is not toward me as before.And the God of my father has been with me.
And you know that with all my power I have served your father.
And your father has deceived me, and changedmy wages in ten ways, but God did not let himhurt me.
If he said thus: “The speckledshall be your wages,” then all the flock bore speckled.And if he said thus: “The striped shall be your wages,”then all the flock bore striped.
ThusGod has taken away the livestock of your father, and given them to me.
And it was at the time that the flock conceived, and I raisedmy eyes, and saw in a dream: and, lo, the ramswhich walked with the flock were striped, speckled, andspotted.
And the angel of God said to mein a dream, “Jacob,” and I said, “Lo, I am here.”
And he said, “Lift up now your eyes, and see, allthe rams which walk with the livestock are striped, speckled, andspotted. Because I have seen everything that Laban is doing to you.
I am the God of Bethel, where you anointedthe pillar, and where you vowed a vow to me. Now arise,go out from this land, and return to the land of your kindred.”’
And Rachel and Leah answered, and they said to him,‘Is there still a portion or share for us in our father’s house?
Lo, were are thought of as strangers by him, because he has sold us,and has devoured our silver as well.
Because allthe wealth that God has taken from our father: it is ours and ourchildren’s. And now, do everything that God has said to you.’
So Jacob rose up, and lifted his sons andhis wives and set them on camels.
And he drove away all his livestock, andall his goods which he gained, the multitude of goods which he had gotten in Paddan-Aram,to go to Isaac, his father, in the land of Canaan.
AndLaban went to shear his sheep. And Rachel stolethe household idols that were her father’s.
AndJacob stole the heart of Laban, the Aramean, by not telling himthat he was fleeing.
And he fled with all that he had,and he rose up, and crossed the river, and set his facetoward mount Gilead.
And it was told to Labanon the third day that Jacob had fled.
And he tookhis brothers with him, and pursued Jacobseven days’ journey, and pursued and he reached him in Mount Gilead.
And an angel came to Laban, the Aramean, in a dream by night,and said to him, ‘Take heed to yourself lest you speak with Jacob:from good to bad.’
Then Laban reachedJacob, and Jacob had pitched his tent in the mountain. And Labanwith his brothers pitched his tent in the mount of Gilead.
And Laban said to Jacob, ‘What have you done, that you have stolenmy heart, and driven away my daughters like captivesof a sword?
Why did you hide to flee away, andstole my heart, and did not tell me? And I would have sent you offwith mirth, and with songs, with a tambourine, and with a qobuz?
And have not left me time to kiss my sonsand my daughters? Now you’ve been foolish to do this.
It is in the power of my hand to do bad to you, butthe God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, “Take heedto yourself lest you speak with Jacob: from good to bad.”
And now, you have gone away because you longed greatlyfor your father’s house, but why did you steal my gods?’
AndJacob answered and said to Laban, ‘I did not tell youthat I go because I was afraid, because I said, “Lest you rob your daughters from me.”

seg type="commented" n="#seg020"/But I did not take your godsanchor type="commented" xml:id="seg020"/, anyone with whom you find your gods,shall not live. In front of our brothers recognize what isyours still with me, and take it to you.’ And Jacob did not know thatRachel had stolen the household idols.
And Laban came inJacob’s tent, and in Leah’s tent, and in the two maidservants’ tents,but he did not find them. And came out from Leah’s tent and came inRachel’s tent.
And Rachel had taken the household idols,and put them in the camel’s saddle, and saton them. And Laban felt |around| the whole tent,but he did not find them.
And she said to her father,‘Let there be no anger in my lord’s eyes that I cannot rise upbefore you, because I have the way of women.’ And he searched, but did not findthe household idols.
And Jacob was angry,and he quarrelled with Laban. And started and said to Laban,‘What is my trespass? What is my sin, that you have pursued me,
That you have felt through all my vessels? What did you find of allyour household vessels? Set it here, before my brothersthat are also your brothers, that they may judgebetween us two.
These twenty years I have been with you.Your ewes and your |female| goats have not miscarried,and I have not eaten the rams of your flocks.
What was torn up |by wild beasts| I did not bring to you.I would bear the punishment of it myself: you would require it from my hand,whether stolen by day or stolen by night.
I wasthe herdsman of your flock, the drought of sun burned me by day,and the cold by night, and my sleep disturbed me and fled from my eyes.
These were for me twenty years in your house. I servedyou fourteen years for your two daughters, and six yearsfor your flock, and you have changed my wages in ten ways.

If the help of the God of my father, the Godof Abraham and the Fear of Isaac, had not been on my side,by now you would have sent me away empty. God saw my affliction and the labourof my hands and rebuked you last night.’

And Laban answered and said to Jacob, ‘These daughtersare my daughters, and these children are my children, and these flocks are my flocks,and all that you see is mine. But what can I do to my daughters, to these,today, or to their children whom they have borne?
So now come, let us make a covenant, I and you. And let it befor a witness between me and you.’
And Jacob took a stone,and set it up for a pillar.
And Jacob saidto his brothers, ‘Gather stones,’ and they took stones and madea heap. And they ate there at the heap.
AndLaban called it Jegar-Sahadutha, but Jacob called it Galeed.
And Laban said, ‘This heap is a witness between meand you this day.’ On account of this he called its name Galeed,
And Watchtower, because he said, ‘May the Lord watch between me and youwhen we hide from one another.
If you shall afflictmy daughters, or if you shall take other wives beside my daughters, noother man is with us, see, God is witness between me and you.’
And Laban said to Jacob, ‘Behold this heap,and behold this pillar, which I have set between me and you.

This heap is a witness, and this pillar is a witness:that I may not pass over this heap to you if I were hostile to you,and, if you were hostile to me, that you may not pass overthis heap and over this pillar to me,for bad.
The God of Abraham, and the Godof Nahor, Elohei the God of their father, judge between us.’ AndJacob swore by the Fear of his father Isaac.
And Jacob offered sacrifice in the mountain, and called his brothers to eatbread, and they ate bread, and spent the night in the mountain.

app.note: A mistranslation based on the consfusion of Heb. מִצְפָּה ‘Mizpah (a place in Gilead)’ and Heb. מִצְפֶּה ‘1. watchtower; 2. lookout’. Translated correctly in C, V, and R.
